00032 int PulseViewer::BeforeFirstEntry(TGlobalData* gData,TSetupData *setup){
00033    // Check we're also running with the ExportPulse module
00034    if(!ExportPulse::Instance()){
00035            cout<<"PulseViewer: Error: You need to run with ExportPulse to use PulseViewer module"<<std::endl;
00036            return 1;
00037    }
00038    
00039    // Check the channel is valid
00040    if(!fChannel.isValid()){
00041            cout<<"PulseViewer: Error: No detector called '"<<fRequestedChannel<<"' exists"<<endl;
00042            return 2;
00043    }
00044    
00045    // Parse the trigger string
00046    return ParseTriggerString(fTriggerCondition);
00047 }
00048 
00049 int PulseViewer::ParseTriggerString(const std::string& trigger_condition){
00050         // Look for something like 'amplitude > 3'
00051         size_t equality_start=trigger_condition.find_first_of("<>=");
00052         if(equality_start==std::string::npos) {
00053                 cout<<"Error: trigger '"<<trigger_condition<<"'' doesn't contain an equality (==,>,<,<=,>=)"<<endl;
00054                 return 1;
00055         }
00056         // Check the type of equality given
00057         int retVal=0;
00058         retVal=SetTriggerType(trigger_condition.substr(equality_start,2));
00059         if(retVal!=0) return retVal;
00060 
00061         // Check the parameter to compare
00062         retVal=SetTriggerParameter(GetOneWord(trigger_condition,0,equality_start));
00063         if(retVal!=0) return retVal;
00064 
00065         // Get the value to compare to
00066         retVal=SetTriggerValue(trigger_condition.substr(equality_start+fTypeString.size()));
00067         return retVal;
00068 }
00069 
00070 int PulseViewer::SetTriggerType(const std::string& equality){
00071         bool problem=false;
00072         if(equality[1]=='='){
00073                 switch(equality[0]){
00074                         case '<': fTriggerType=kLE; break;
00075                         case '>': fTriggerType=kGE; break;
00076                         case '=': fTriggerType=kE; break;
00077                         default:
00078                                   problem=true;
00079                 }
00080                 if(!problem)fTypeString=equality.substr(0,2);
00081         } else{
00082                 switch(equality[0]){
00083                         case '<': fTriggerType=kL; break;
00084                         case '>': fTriggerType=kG; break;
00085                         case '=': 
00086                         default:
00087                                   problem=true;
00088                 }
00089                 if(!problem)fTypeString=equality[0];
00090         }
00091         if(problem){
00092           cout<<"Error: Unknown equality-type passed to PulseViewer: '"<<equality<<"'"<<endl;
00093           return 2;
00094         }
00095         return 0;
00096 }
00097 
00098 int PulseViewer::SetTriggerParameter(const std::string& parameter){
00099   typedef std::map<std::string,ParameterType> ParameterKeys;
00100   static ParameterKeys available_params;
00101   if(available_params.empty()){
00102      available_params["amplitude"]=kAmplitude;
00103      available_params["time"]=kTime;
00104      available_params["TPI_length"]=kTPILength;
00105      available_params["integral"]=kIntegral;
00106      available_params["energy"]=kEnergy;
00107      available_params["pedestal"]=kPedestal;
00108      available_params["trigger_time"]=kTriggerTime;
00109   }
00110   ParameterKeys::iterator it=available_params.find(parameter);
00111         if(it!=available_params.end()){
00112     fTriggerParameter=it->second;
00113   }else{
00114                 cout<<"Error: Unknown parameter requested: '"<<parameter<<"'"<<endl;
00115                 cout<<"   Possible values are:"<<endl;
00116     for(it=available_params.begin();it!=available_params.end();it++){
00117                      cout<<"    |-"<<it->first<<endl;
00118     }
00119                 return 1;
00120         }
00121         fParameterString=parameter;
00122         return 0;
00123 }

00125 int PulseViewer::SetTriggerValue(const std::string& parameter){
00126         fTriggerValue=GetDouble(parameter);
00127         return 0;
00128 }

00130 int PulseViewer::ProcessEntry(TGlobalData* gData,TSetupData *setup){
00131 
00132     // Get the TAPs for this channel
00133   AnalysedPulseList* allTAPs=&gAnalysedPulseMap[GetChannel()];
00134 
00135     if(!allTAPs){
00136        cout<<"Problem getting TAP list for "<<GetChannel()<<endl;
00137             return 1;
00138     }else if(allTAPs->empty() ){
00139        if(Debug()) cout<<"List of TAPS for '"<< GetChannel()<<"' was empty "<<endl;
00140        return 0;
00141     }
00142 
00143     // Check each TAP against trigger
00144     int retVal=0;
00145     for(AnalysedPulseList::iterator i_pulse=allTAPs->begin();
00146                 i_pulse!=allTAPs->end() && retVal==0;
00147                 i_pulse++){
00148             retVal=ConsiderDrawing(*i_pulse);
00149     }
00150     if(retVal!=0) return retVal;
00151 
00152   return 0;
00153 }

00155 double PulseViewer::GetParameterValue(const TAnalysedPulse& pulse){
00156         double retVal=0;
00157         switch (fTriggerParameter){
00158         case kAmplitude:
00159                 retVal=pulse.GetAmplitude();
00160                 break;
00161         case kTime:
00162                 retVal=pulse.GetTime();
00163                 break;
00164         case kIntegral:
00165                 retVal=pulse.GetIntegral();
00166                 break;
00167         case kTPILength:
00168                 retVal=pulse.GetTPILength();
00169     break;
00170     case kEnergy:
00171     retVal=pulse.GetEnergy();
00172     break;
00173     case kPedestal:
00174     retVal=pulse.GetPedestal();
00175     break;
00176     case kTriggerTime:
00177     retVal=pulse.GetTriggerTime();
00178                 break;
00179         }
00180         return retVal;
00181 }
00182 
00183 bool PulseViewer::ValuePassesTrigger(const double& value){
00184         bool retVal=false;
00185   switch (fTriggerType){
00186           case kE:
00187                   retVal=(value==fTriggerValue);
00188                   break;
00189           case kG:
00190                   retVal=(value>fTriggerValue);
00191                   break;
00192           case kL:
00193                   retVal=(value<fTriggerValue);
00194                   break;
00195           case kGE:
00196                   retVal=(value>=fTriggerValue);
00197                   break;
00198           case kLE:
00199                   retVal=(value<=fTriggerValue);
00200                   break;
00201   }
00202   return retVal;
00203 }
00204 
00205 int PulseViewer::ConsiderDrawing(const TAnalysedPulse* pulse){
00206         // Check pulse passes trigger condition
00207         double value=GetParameterValue(*pulse);
00208         if(!ValuePassesTrigger(value)) return 0;
00209         if(Debug()){
00210                 cout<<fParameterString<<" = "<<value<<" which is "<<fTypeString<<" " <<fTriggerValue<<endl; 
00211         }
00212 
00213         // If it does, ask ExportPulse to draw it
00214         // We're safe to assume Instance will return becuase we test it's
00215         // existence in BeforeFirstEntry
00216         ExportPulse::Instance()->AddToExportList(pulse);
00217         return 0;
00218 }
